subject: Curlin (Race Horse)
Auctions
lead_paragraph: A judge refused to force an auction of an ownership stake in Curlin, the Horse of the Year, saying the request has been made too soon. Special Judge Roger Crittenden left the door open for 418 people to pursue a 20 percent ownership stake. The judge made his decision during a hearing on Tuesday after concluding that the plaintiffs did not have enough information about the assets of the lawyers William Gallion and Shirley Cunningham Jr. The two men are accused of bilking former clients out of at least $42 million in a $200 million settlement involving the diet drug Fen-phen.
